info.name: DRV3205
info.desc: The bridge driver is dedicated to automotive 3-phase brushless DC motor control applications including safety motor control applications. The device provides 6 dedicated drivers for standard-level N-channel MOSFET transistors. The strong driver strength is suitable for high current applications and programmable to limit peak output current. The device incorporates sophisticated diagnosis, protection, and monitoring features through an SPI. A boost converter with an integrated FET provides the overdrive voltage, allowing full control on the power stages even for low battery voltage down to 4.75 V

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: HS_MODE
fields.desc:
Indicates when device in High speed mode for I2C Interface.
0b = Device is not in High speed mode for I2C Interface. 
1b = Device is in High speed mode for I2C Interface.

fields.name: DEV_OPMODE
fields.desc:
Indicates the functional mode of the device.
00b = Device is operating in I2C Command Mode 
01b = Not Used 10b = Device is operating in Autonomous Monitoring Mode 
11b = Device is operating in High Precision Mode

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: TRIG_OFFCAL
fields.desc: Writing 1 into this bit triggers internal offset calibration

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: SEL_OPMODE
fields.desc:
These bits set the functional mode for the device 
000b = I2C Command Mode with Channel 0 (Default Sequence). 
001b = I2C Command Mode with Channel 0 (Default Sequence). 
010b = Reserved, Do not use. 
011b = Reserved, Do not use. 
100b = I2C Command Mode with Auto Sequencing enabled. 
101b = I2C Command Mode with Auto Sequencing enabled. 
110b = Autonomous Monitoring Mode with Auto Sequencing enabled. 
111b = High Precision Mode with Auto Sequencing enabled.

options.display: I2C Command Mode with Channel 0(Default Sequence)
I2C Command Mode with Auto Sequencing enabled
Autonomous Monitoring Mode with Auto Sequencing enabled
High Precision Mode with Auto Sequencing enabled

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: DATA_WORDCOUNT
fields.desc: DATA_WORDCOUNT [00000] to [10000] = Number of entries filled in data buffer (0 to 16)

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: DOUT_FORMAT
fields.desc:
00b = 12-bit conversion result followed by 0000b 
01b = 12-bit conversion result followed by 3-bit Channel ID (000b for CH0, 001b for CH1) 
10b = 12-bit conversion result followed by 3-bit Channel ID (000b for CH0, 001b for CH1) followed by DATA_VALID bit 
11b = 12-bit conversion result followed by 0000b

options.display: ADC Conversion Result + Channel ID + DATA_VALID

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: STARTSTOP_CNTRL
fields.desc:
000b = Stop Burst Mode 
001b = Start Burst Mode, default 
010b = Reserved, do not use 
011b = Reserved, do not use 
100b = Pre Alert Data Mode 
101b = Reserved, do not use 
110b = Post Alert Data Mode 
111b = Reserved, do not use

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: ACC_COUNT
fields.desc: ACC_COUNT = Number of accumulation completed till last finished conversion.

fields.name: ACC_CH0_LSB
fields.desc: Provides the LSB of accumulated data for CH0

fields.name: ACC_CH0_MSB
fields.desc: Provides the MSB of accumulated data for CH0

fields.name: ACC_CH1_LSB
fields.desc: Provides the LSB of accumulated data for CH1

fields.name: ACC_CH1_MSB
fields.desc: Provides the MSB of accumulated data for CH1

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: EN_ACC
fields.desc:
0000b = Accumulator is disabled 
0001b to 1110b = Reserved, do not use 
1111b = Accumulator is enabled

fields.name: ALERT_TRIG_CHID
fields.desc:
Provides the channel ID of channel which was first to set the alert output.
0000b = Channel 
0 0001b = Channel 1
0010b to 1111b = Not used

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: ALERT_LOW_CH1
fields.desc:
Indicates alert on low side comparator for CH1 
0b = Alert is not set for low side comparator for CH1 
1b = Alert is set for low side comparator for CH1.

fields.name: ALERT_LOW_CH0
fields.desc:
Indicates alert on low side comparator for CH0 
0b = Alert is not set for low side comparator for CH0 
1b = Alert is set for low side comparator for CH0.

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: ALERT_HIGH_CH1
fields.desc:
Indicates alert on high side comparator for CH1 
0b = Alert is not set for high side comparator for CH1 
1b = Alert is set for high side comparator for CH1.

fields.name: ALERT_HIGH_CH0
fields.desc:
Indicates alert on high side comparator for CH0 
0b = Alert is not set for high side comparator for CH0 
1b = Alert is set for high side comparator for CH0.

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: ALERT_EN_CH1
fields.desc:
Enables alert for Channel 1
0b = Alert is disabled for CH1 
1b = Alert is enabled for CH1, default

fields.name: ALERT_EN_CH0
fields.desc:
Enables alert for Channel 0
0b = Alert is disabled for CH0 
1b = Alert is enabled for CH0, default

fields.name: PREALERT_COUNT
fields.desc: Sets the Pre-Alert Event Count = PREALERT_COUNT[3:0] + 1

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: DWC_BLOCK_EN
fields.desc:
Enables the alert and digital comparator block
 0 = Disables Digital Window Comparator 
1 = Enables Digital Window Comparator

fields.name: HTH_CH0_LSB
fields.desc: 8 least significant bits of high threshold for CH0

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: HTH_CH0_MSB
fields.desc: 4 most significant bits of high threshold for CH0

fields.name: LTH_CH0_LSB
fields.desc: 8 least significant bits of low threshold for CH0

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: LTH_CH0_MSB
fields.desc: 4 most significant bits of low threshold for CH0

fields.name: HTH_CH1_LSB
fields.desc: 8 least significant bits of high threshold for CH1

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: HTH_CH1_MSB
fields.desc: 4 most significant bits of high threshold for CH1

fields.name: LTH_CH1_LSB
fields.desc: 8 least significant bits of low threshold for CH1

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: LTH_CH1_MSB
fields.desc: 4 most significant bits of low threshold for CH1

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: HYS_CH0
fields.desc: Hysteresis for both comparators for CH0

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: HYS_CH1
fields.desc: Hysteresis for both comparators for CH1

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: SEQ_ERR_ST
fields.desc:
Status of device sequence 
00b = Auto Sequencing disabled, no error.
01b = Auto Sequencing enabled, no error. 
10b = Not used 
11b = Auto Sequencing enabled, device in error.

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: SEQ_START
fields.desc: Setting this bit = 1 brings the BUSY/RDY pin high and starts the first conversion in the sequence

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: SEQ_ABORT
fields.desc: Setting this bit = 1 aborts the ongoing conversion and brings the BUSY/RDY pin low

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: AUTOSEQ_EN_CH1
fields.desc:
0 = Channel 1 is not selected for auto sequencing 
1= Channel 1 is selected for auto sequencing

fields.name: AUTOSEQ_EN_CH0
fields.desc:
0 = Channel 0 is not selected for auto sequencing
 1= Channel 0 is selected for auto sequencing

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: DEV_RST
fields.desc: Writing 1 into this bit resets the device

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: KEYWORD
fields.desc: Write 1010b into these bits to get write access for the DEVICE_RESET register

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: HSZ_LP
fields.desc:
selects the oscillator used for the conversion process.
0b = Device uses High Speed Oscillator 
1b = Device uses Low Power Oscillator

fields.name: nCLK
fields.desc:
Sets number of clocks of the oscillator that the device uses for one conversion cycle
When using the High Speed Oscillator:
 00000000b to 00010101b = nCLK is set to 21 
 00010110b = nCLK is set to 22 
 00010111b = nCLK is set to 23 and so on till 
 11111111b = nCLK is set to 255 
When using the Low Power Oscillator: 
 00000000b to 00010010b = nCLK is set to 18 
 00010011b = nCLK is set to 19 
 00010100b = nCLK is set to 20 and so on till 
 11111111b = nCLK is set to 255

fields.name: Reserved
fields.desc: Reserved Bits. Read returns 0000b

fields.name: CH0_CH1_IP_CFG
fields.desc:
Selects configuration for the input pins 
00b = Two-Channel, Single-Ended configuration 
01b = Single-Channel, Single-Ended configuration with Remote Ground Sensing 
10b = Single-Channel, Pseudo-Differential configuration 
11b = Two-Channel, Single-Ended configuration

options.display: Single-Channel-Single-Ended configuration with Remote Ground Sensing
